info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 8:45AM MST until January 13 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds 30 to 40 mph, with higher speeds possible. Gusts approaching 50 mph. * WHERE...Central Colorado River Basin. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility, especially in open areas. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of gusty winds and snow could lead to brief whiteout conditions in the advised area.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
